title: Structure
description:
Defines a physical object that interacts with the electromagnetic fields.
A :class:`Structure` is a combination of a material property (:class:`AbstractMedium`)
and a :class:`Geometry`.

Example
-------
>>> box = Box(center=(0,0,1), size=(2, 2, 2))
>>> glass = Medium(permittivity=3.9)
>>> struct = Structure(geometry=box, medium=glass, name='glass_box')

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: Defines spatial extent of the structure.

medium.title: Medium
medium.description: Defines the electromagnetic properties of the structure material.

Box.title: Box
Box.description:
Rectangular prism.
   Also base class for :class:`Simulation`, :class:`Monitor`, and :class:`Source`.

Example
-------
>>> b = Box(center=(1,2,3), size=(2,2,2))

center.title: Center
center.description: Center of object in x, y, and z.

size.title: Size
size.description: Size in x, y, and z directions.

Sphere.title: Sphere
Sphere.description:
Spherical geometry.

Example
-------
>>> b = Sphere(center=(1,2,3), radius=2)

center.title: Center
center.description: Center of object in x, y, and z.

Cylinder.title: Cylinder
Cylinder.description:
Cylindrical geometry.

Example
-------
>>> c = Cylinder(center=(1,2,3), radius=2, length=5, axis=2)

center.title: Center
center.description: Center of object in x, y, and z.

axis.title: Axis
axis.description: Specifies dimension of the planar axis (0,1,2) -> (x,y,z).

length.title: Length
length.description: Defines thickness of cylinder along axis dimension.

PolySlab.title: PolySlab
PolySlab.description:
Polygon with constant thickness (slab) along axis direction.

Example
-------
>>> p = PolySlab(vertices=[(0,0), (1,0), (1,1)], axis=2, slab_bounds=(-1, 1))

center.title: Center
center.description: Center of object in x, y, and z.

axis.title: Axis
axis.description: Specifies dimension of the planar axis (0,1,2) -> (x,y,z).

length.title: Length
length.description: Defines thickness of geometry along axis dimension.

slab_bounds.title: Slab Bounds
slab_bounds.description: Minimum and maximum positions of the slab along axis dimension.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: List of (d1, d2) defining the 2 dimensional positions of the polygon face vertices along dimensions parallel to slab normal axis.

Medium.title: Medium
Medium.description:
Dispersionless medium.

Example
-------
>>> dielectric = Medium(permittivity=4.0, name='my_medium')
>>> eps = dielectric.eps_model(200e12)

frequency_range.title: Frequency Range
frequency_range.description: Optional range of validity for the medium.

conductivity.title: Conductivity
conductivity.description: Electric conductivity.  Defined such that the imaginary part of the complex permittivity at angular frequency omega is given by conductivity/omega.

AnisotropicMedium.title: AnisotropicMedium
AnisotropicMedium.description:
Diagonally anisotripic medium.

Note
----
Only diagonal anisotropy and non-dispersive components are currently supported.

Example
-------
>>> medium_xx = Medium(permittivity=4.0)
>>> medium_yy = Medium(permittivity=4.1)
>>> medium_zz = Medium(permittivity=3.9)
>>> anisotropic_dielectric = AnisotropicMedium(xx=medium_xx, yy=medium_yy, zz=medium_zz)

frequency_range.title: Frequency Range
frequency_range.description: Optional range of validity for the medium.

xx.title: XX Component
xx.description: Medium describing the xx-component of the diagonal permittivity tensor.

yy.title: YY Component
yy.description: Medium describing the yy-component of the diagonal permittivity tensor.

zz.title: ZZ Component
zz.description: Medium describing the zz-component of the diagonal permittivity tensor.

PECMedium.title: PECMedium
PECMedium.description:
Perfect electrical conductor class.

Note
----
To avoid confusion from duplicate PECs, should import ``tidy3d.PEC`` instance directly.

frequency_range.title: Frequency Range
frequency_range.description: Optional range of validity for the medium.

ComplexNumber.title: ComplexNumber
ComplexNumber.description: Holds real and imaginary parts of a complex number.

PoleResidue.title: PoleResidue
PoleResidue.description:
A dispersive medium described by the pole-residue pair model.
The frequency-dependence of the complex-valued permittivity is described by:

.. math::

    \epsilon(\omega) = \epsilon_\infty - \sum_i
    \left[\frac{c_i}{j \omega + a_i} +
    \frac{c_i^*}{j \omega + a_i^*}\right]

where :math:`a_i` and :math:`c_i` are in units of rad/s.

Parameters
----------
eps_inf : float = 1.0
    Relative permittivity at infinite frequency (:math:`\epsilon_\infty`).
poles : List[Tuple[complex, complex]]
    List of complex-valued (:math:`a_i, c_i`) poles for the model.
frequeuncy_range : Tuple[float, float] = (-inf, inf)
    Range of validity for the medium in Hz.
    If simulation or plotting functions use frequency out of this range, a warning is thrown.
name : str = None
    Optional name for the medium.

Example
-------
>>> pole_res = PoleResidue(eps_inf=2.0, poles=[(1+2j, 3+4j), (5+6j, 7+8j)])
>>> eps = pole_res.eps_model(200e12)

frequency_range.title: Frequency Range
frequency_range.description: Optional range of validity for the medium.

poles.title: Poles
poles.description: List of complex-valued (:math:`a_i, c_i`) poles for the model.

Sellmeier.title: Sellmeier
Sellmeier.description:
A dispersive medium described by the Sellmeier model.
The frequency-dependence of the refractive index is described by:

.. math::

    n(\lambda)^2 = 1 + \sum_i \frac{B_i \lambda^2}{\lambda^2 - C_i}

where :math:`\lambda` is in microns, :math:`B_i` is unitless and :math:`C_i` is in microns^2.

Parameters
----------
coeffs : List[Tuple[float, float]]
    List of Sellmeier (:math:`B_i, C_i`) coefficients.
frequeuncy_range : Tuple[float, float] = (-inf, inf)
    Range of validity for the medium in Hz.
    If simulation or plotting functions use frequency out of this range, a warning is thrown.
name : str = None
    Optional name for the medium.

Example
-------
>>> sellmeier_medium = Sellmeier(coeffs=[(1,2), (3,4)])
>>> eps = sellmeier_medium.eps_model(200e12)

frequency_range.title: Frequency Range
frequency_range.description: Optional range of validity for the medium.

Lorentz.title: Lorentz
Lorentz.description:
A dispersive medium described by the Lorentz model.
The frequency-dependence of the complex-valued permittivity is described by:

.. math::
    \epsilon(f) = \epsilon_\infty + \sum_i
    \frac{\Delta\epsilon_i f_i^2}{f_i^2 + 2jf\delta_i - f^2}

where :math:`f, f_i, \delta_i` are in Hz.

Parameters
----------
eps_inf : float = 1.0
    Relative permittivity at infinite frequency (:math:`\epsilon_\infty`).
coeffs : List[Tuple[float, float, float]]
    List of (:math:`\Delta\epsilon_i, f_i, \delta_i`) values for model.
frequeuncy_range : Tuple[float, float] = (-inf, inf)
    Range of validity for the medium in Hz.
    If simulation or plotting functions use frequency out of this range, a warning is thrown.
name : str = None
    Optional name for the medium.

Example
-------
>>> lorentz_medium = Lorentz(eps_inf=2.0, coeffs=[(1,2,3), (4,5,6)])
>>> eps = lorentz_medium.eps_model(200e12)

frequency_range.title: Frequency Range
frequency_range.description: Optional range of validity for the medium.

coeffs.title: Epsilon at Infinity
coeffs.description: List of (:math:`\Delta\epsilon_i, f_i, \delta_i`) values for model.

Debye.title: Debye
Debye.description:
A dispersive medium described by the Debye model.
The frequency-dependence of the complex-valued permittivity is described by:

.. math::
    \epsilon(f) = \epsilon_\infty + \sum_i
    \frac{\Delta\epsilon_i}{1 + jf\tau_i}

where :math:`f` is in Hz, and :math:`\tau_i` is in seconds.

Parameters
----------
eps_inf : float = 1.0
    Relative permittivity at infinite frequency (:math:`\epsilon_\infty`).
coeffs : List[Tuple[float, float, float]]
    List of (:math:`\Delta\epsilon_i, \tau_i`) values for model.
frequeuncy_range : Tuple[float, float] = (-inf, inf)
    Range of validity for the medium in Hz.
    If simulation or plotting functions use frequency out of this range, a warning is thrown.
name : str = None
    Optional name for the medium.

Example
-------
>>> debye_medium = Debye(eps_inf=2.0, coeffs=[(1,2),(3,4)])
>>> eps = debye_medium.eps_model(200e12)

frequency_range.title: Frequency Range
frequency_range.description: Optional range of validity for the medium.

Drude.title: Drude
Drude.description:
A dispersive medium described by the Drude model.
The frequency-dependence of the complex-valued permittivity is described by:

.. math::
    \epsilon(f) = \epsilon_\infty - \sum_i
    \frac{ f_i^2}{f^2 - jf\delta_i}

where :math:`f, f_i, \delta_i` are in Hz.

Parameters
----------
eps_inf : float = 1.0
    Relative permittivity at infinite frequency (:math:`\epsilon_\infty`).
coeffs : List[Tuple[float, float]]
    List of (:math:`f_i, \delta_i`) values for model.
frequeuncy_range : Tuple[float, float] = (-inf, inf)
    Range of validity for the medium in Hz.
    If simulation or plotting functions use frequency out of this range, a warning is thrown.
name : str = None
    Optional name for the medium.

Example
-------
>>> drude_medium = Drude(eps_inf=2.0, coeffs=[(1,2), (3,4)])
>>> eps = drude_medium.eps_model(200e12)

frequency_range.title: Frequency Range
frequency_range.description: Optional range of validity for the medium.
